flashcards.english: Vowels: a (Africa), e (Estuary), i (India), o (office), u (ooze), ĩ (Ate/Gate), ũ (Owner). Consonants: B (soft bilabial fricative like soft V/W), C (sh/ch sound)
flashcards.notes: Nĩtwĩrĩririkanie (Let us remember). 7 cardinal vowels with tilde marking different openness degrees. B is NOT hard English B but soft like mahaBharat. C is between sh/ch sounds

flashcards.kikuyu: Digestive System (Ciĩga cia njĩra ya irio)
flashcards.english: Inĩ (liver), Nyongo (gallbladder), Nda (stomach), Rwarĩũngũ (pancreas), Mara (small intestine), Mũtũra (large intestine), Gataathĩra (appendix), Mũkwa (rectum), Itina (anus - impolite)
flashcards.notes: Ciĩga cia njĩra ya irio = 'parts of the path of food' (digestive system). Itina is impolite to use in public. Complete anatomical vocabulary

flashcards.english: Rĩũ (now), Mũrĩũ (drunk person), Hĩũ (cooked/ready to eat), Kĩũ (that big one). Verbs: Ĩra (tell), Rĩra (cry), Rarĩra (sleep without supper), Ĩkĩrĩra (put in container for someone)
flashcards.notes: Illustrates importance of correct tone/length/prefix. Examples: Rĩũ ngũrĩa kĩĩ? (What will I eat now?), Rĩra hanini (Cry a little), Rarĩra ũkarĩa rũciũ (Sleep without eating and eat tomorrow)

flashcards.english: Gĩtĩ/Itĩ (chair/chairs), Gĩkombe/Ikombe (cup/cups), Kĩrĩma/Ciĩma (mountain/mountains), Kĩratũ/Cĩratũ (shoe/shoes), Gĩtonga/Itonga (tycoon/tycoons), Kĩhĩĩ/Cĩhĩĩ (youth/youths), Kĩng'angĩ/Ciũng'angĩ (crocodile/crocodiles)
flashcards.notes: Class 4: Kĩ-/Gĩ- (singular) → Ci-/I- (plural). Demonstratives: Gĩkĩ/Kĩkĩ (this) → Ici/Cici (these). Numbers: Kĩmwe (one) → Igĩrĩ (two). Abstract nouns: Kĩeha (sadness), Gĩkeno (happiness)
